question:
Which of the following are needed for Skype to function on a computer?

A web cam

2. A microphone

3. A speaker

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
solution:
• For Skype to function properly on a computer, all three components are needed:
    • A webcam to show your video to others.
    • A microphone to capture your voice for calls.
    • A speaker to hear the other person during the conversation.
  • Skype is a video calling and messaging application, so all these hardware devices work together for effective communication.

Additional Information:

  • Without a webcam, video calling won't be possible, but audio calls may still work.
  • Without a microphone or speaker, voice communication is not possible.
  • Many laptops have built-in webcams, microphones, and speakers, while desktops may require external devices.

question:
Which of the following is an input device?

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
solution:
• Keyboard is an input device used to enter data and commands into a computer.
  • It allows users to type text, numbers, and execute commands by pressing keys.

Additional Information:

  • Speaker is an output device that produces sound.
  • Monitor is an output device that displays visuals on the screen.
  • Printer is an output device that produces hard copies of documents or images.

question:
In File Explorer of Windows 11, to reduce the space between files, select View > ______ view.

CHSL 2023 Tier II
solution:
• In Windows 11 File Explorer, to reduce the space between files, select View > Compact view.
  • The Compact view arranges files and folders closer together, allowing more items to be visible on the screen without much empty space.
  • This helps users to manage and navigate files more efficiently when dealing with many items.

Additional Information:

  • Wide view shows files with more spacing and wider preview.
  • Cloud and Stretch views are not standard options in File Explorer for adjusting spacing.
  • Compact view is especially useful on smaller screens or when working with large numbers of files.

question:
In File Explorer of Windows 10, the keyboard shortcut ‘Num Lock + Asterisk sign (*)’ is used to ______.

CGL 2023 Tier II Paper I
option_1: open the properties dialog box for the selected item
option_2: collapse the selected folder
option_3: display the contents of the selected folder
option_4: display all subfolders under the selected folder
solution:
• In Windows 10 File Explorer, the keyboard shortcut Num Lock + Asterisk sign (*) is used to display all subfolders under the selected folder.
  • This shortcut expands the entire folder tree below the selected folder, showing all nested subfolders at once.
  • It helps in quickly viewing the full folder hierarchy without manually expanding each folder.

Additional Information:

  • To collapse the selected folder, the shortcut is usually Num Lock + Minus sign (-).
  • Opening the properties dialog box is done by Alt + Enter.
  • Displaying the contents of a folder is done by clicking or pressing Enter on the folder.

question:
Which backup device provides a convenient way to create system images and complete backups, but may require a lengthy restoration process?

CGL 2023 Tier II Paper I
solution:
• Tape Drive is a backup device that provides a convenient way to create system images and complete backups, especially for large amounts of data.
  • Tape drives are reliable and cost-effective for long-term storage and archival backups.
  • However, restoring data from tape drives can be a lengthy process because the data is stored sequentially, making retrieval slower compared to other storage devices.

Additional Information:

  • Network-attached storage (NAS) offers centralized backups but usually restores faster than tape drives.
  • Solid-state drives (SSD) provide fast backup and restoration but are costlier for large-scale backups.
  • DVD-RW discs have limited storage capacity and slower speed, suitable only for small backups.

question:
Which of the following is an example of the input device in a computer?

CGL 2023 Tier II Paper I
solution:
• Touchscreen is an example of an input device because it allows users to interact directly with the display by touching it.
  • It can also act as an output device by displaying visuals, but its key feature is accepting input through touch gestures.

Additional Information:

  • Printer is an output device that produces physical copies of documents.
  • Speaker is an output device that produces sound.
  • Monitor is an output device that displays images and videos.

question:
In File Explorer of Windows 11, which of the following tabs includes the ‘hidden items’ option?

CGL 2023 Tier II Paper I
solution:
• In Windows 11 File Explorer, the ‘Hidden items’ option is found under the View tab.
  • This option allows users to show or hide files and folders that are marked as hidden.
  • Enabling “Hidden items” makes these files visible in the file explorer for easier access and management.

Additional Information:

  • The Home tab contains basic file operations like copy, paste, and delete.
  • The Share tab is used for sharing files with others.
  • The File tab provides general file explorer settings and options like opening a new window or accessing properties.

question:
Which of the following is NOT an output device?

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier I
solution:
• Bar code reader is not an output device; it is an input device.
  • It reads barcodes and inputs the data into the computer system.
  • Monitor, plotter, and dot matrix printer are all output devices that display or print data from the computer.

Additional Information:

  • Monitor displays visual output on the screen.
  • Plotter produces large-scale drawings and graphics on paper.
  • Dot matrix printer prints characters and images by striking pins on an ink ribbon against paper.

question:
Neeti wants to use an input device that works by sensing the user’s finger movement and downward pressure. Which among the following should she use?

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier I
solution:
• Neeti should use a Touchpad as the input device.
  • A touchpad senses the user’s finger movement and downward pressure to control the cursor on the screen.
  • It is commonly used on laptops as a built-in pointing device.

Additional Information:

  • A Scanner converts physical documents into digital images.
  • A Light pen detects light from the screen to select objects but does not sense pressure.
  • A Keyboard inputs text and commands by pressing keys, not finger movement or pressure sensing.

question:
Rishu wants to input data to the computer by pressing keys. Which input device should he use?

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier I
solution:
• Rishu should use a Keyboard to input data by pressing keys.
  • A keyboard allows users to enter text, numbers, and commands into the computer by pressing different keys.
  • It is the most common and essential input device for typing.

Additional Information:

  • A Scanner converts physical documents into digital images.
  • A Joystick is primarily used for gaming and controlling cursor movement, not typing.
  • A Light Pen is used to point or draw on the screen but not for typing data.

question:
Which of the following is an output device?

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier I
option_2: MICR (Magnetic Ink Character Recognition (MICR))
solution:
• Projector is an output device that displays images or videos onto a large screen or surface.
  • It is used to present visual content to a larger audience.

Additional Information:

  • OCR (Optical Character Recognition) device is an input device that converts printed text into digital data.
  • MICR (Magnetic Ink Character Recognition) is an input technology used mainly in banking to read characters printed with magnetic ink.
  • Scanner is an input device that converts physical documents or images into digital form.

question:
What is an output device that transforms the signal from the computer's sound card into audio?

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier I
solution:
• Speaker is an output device that transforms the signal from the computer’s sound card into audio.
  • It converts electronic audio signals into sound waves that can be heard by the user.

Additional Information:

  • Graphics card handles video output, not audio.
  • Plotter is used to print large graphics and drawings on paper.
  • Monitor displays visual output from the computer.

question:
Pick the odd one out in Central Processing Unit (CPU) of a computer.

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier I
option_2: ALU and Control Unit both
solution:
• The Output Unit is the odd one out because it is not part of the Central Processing Unit (CPU).
  • The CPU mainly consists of the Arithmetic Logic Unit (ALU) and the Control Unit (CU), which handle processing and control tasks.
  • The Output Unit is a separate component responsible for displaying or sending out processed data from the CPU to external devices.

Additional Information:

  • ALU performs arithmetic and logical operations.
  • Control Unit manages and directs the operations of the CPU.
  • Output Unit includes devices like monitors and printers, which are outside the CPU.

question:
Which of the following is an input device?

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier I
solution:
• Keyboard is an input device used to enter data and commands into a computer.
  • It allows users to type text, numbers, and execute commands by pressing keys.

Additional Information:

  • Plotter is an output device used for printing large-scale graphics.
  • Printer is an output device that produces physical copies of documents.
  • Speaker is an output device that produces sound.

question:
Speed of ______ printer is measured in characters per second (CPS).

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier I
solution:
• The speed of a Dot Matrix printer is measured in characters per second (CPS).
  • Dot Matrix printers print characters by striking pins against an ink ribbon, so speed is naturally measured by how many characters it can print per second.

Additional Information:

  • Ink-Jet and Laser printers measure speed in pages per minute (PPM).
  • Line printers print entire lines at a time and are measured differently, usually in lines per minute.
  • Dot Matrix printers are used for multi-part forms and carbon copies.

question:
Video Graphics Array connectors are those which connect the monitor to a computer’s video card and has ______ holes.

CGL 2022 Tier II Paper I
solution:
• Video Graphics Array (VGA) connectors have 15 holes (pins).
  • VGA connectors are used to connect a computer’s video card to the monitor for analog video signal transmission.
  • The 15-pin connector is typically arranged in three rows of five pins each.

Additional Information:

  • VGA was the standard display interface before digital connections like DVI and HDMI became popular.
  • It supports resolutions up to 640x480 (standard VGA), though extended versions support higher resolutions.

question:
Which among the following is incorrect about Laser Printers?

CGL 2022 Tier II Paper I
option_2: Can print multiple copies at a time
option_3: Supports multiple fonts and sizes
option_4: Uses laser lights for producing dots to form characters on a page
solution:
• Option (b) Can print multiple copies at a time is incorrect about Laser Printers.
  • Laser printers print one copy at a time, although they can print multiple pages quickly. They do not produce multiple copies simultaneously like some impact printers (e.g., dot matrix) using carbon copies.
  • Laser printers are known for fast speed, support for multiple fonts and sizes, and use laser lights to produce dots that form characters on the page.

Additional Information:

  • Impact printers like dot matrix can print multiple copies simultaneously using carbon paper.
  • Laser printers provide high-quality, precise printing suitable for text and graphics.
  • They use a laser beam to create an electrostatic image on a drum, which then attracts toner to print on paper.

question:
________ cookies track you and expose your privacy.

CGL 2022 Tier II Paper I
solution:
• Third-party cookies track users across multiple websites and can expose user privacy.
  • These cookies are set by domains other than the one the user is visiting and are commonly used for advertising and tracking purposes.
  • They collect data about browsing habits, often without the user's explicit consent.

Additional Information:

  • Session cookies are temporary and deleted when the browser is closed.
  • Persistent cookies remain on the device for a set period and are used for remembering login details or preferences.
  • Zombie cookies are cookies that reappear after deletion, but third-party cookies are more commonly associated with privacy concerns.

question:
________ is a high-speed device used in CPU that is utilised to store data temporarily during processing.

CGL 2022 Tier II Paper I
option_2: Arithmetic and Logic Unit (ALU)
solution:
• Registers are high-speed storage devices within the CPU used to temporarily store data during processing.
  • They hold data, instructions, and addresses that the CPU needs immediate access to while executing programs.
  • Registers operate much faster than other types of memory like RAM or auxiliary memory.

Additional Information:

  • Auxiliary Memory refers to secondary storage like hard drives or SSDs, which are slower and used for long-term storage.
  • Arithmetic and Logic Unit (ALU) performs mathematical and logical operations but does not store data.
  • Control Unit directs the operations of the CPU but does not store data temporarily.

question:
Which among the following statements is incorrect?

CGL 2022 Tier II Paper I
option_1: Cache memory stores data in permanent use.
option_2: Cache memory is faster than main memory.
option_3: Cache memory keeps the programs that can be run in a short amount of time.
option_4: The size of cache is usually small.
solution:
• Option (a) Cache memory stores data in permanent use is incorrect.
  • Cache memory stores data and instructions that are frequently used or likely to be used soon, but it is volatile and does not store data permanently.
  • Cache is much faster than main memory and helps speed up data access by the CPU.

Additional Information:

  • Cache memory keeps programs and data that can be accessed quickly, improving performance.
  • Cache size is usually small compared to main memory because it is expensive and fast.
  • Data in cache is lost when the computer is turned off because it is volatile memory.

question:
Which among the following statements is incorrect?

CGL 2022 Tier II Paper I
option_1: In the Navigation Pane, there is a Quick Access area.
option_2: Navigation Pane is to enable easier navigation through Windows Explorer.
option_3: The right window of Windows Explorer is called Navigation Pane.
option_4: From the Navigation pane, you can view your computer’s file and folder structure and access files and folders.
solution:
• Option (c) The right window of Windows Explorer is called Navigation Pane is incorrect.
  • The Navigation Pane is actually the left pane in Windows Explorer, used for browsing and accessing drives, folders, and quick access links.
  • The right pane displays the contents (files and folders) of the selected item in the Navigation Pane.

Additional Information:

  • Quick Access area is part of the Navigation Pane for easy access to frequently used folders.
  • The Navigation Pane helps users navigate through the file system efficiently.
  • The right window is often called the Details Pane or simply the Content Pane.

question:
Which among the following devices is also known as Visual Display Unit (VDU)?

CGL 2022 Tier II Paper I
solution:
• Monitor is also known as a Visual Display Unit (VDU).
  • It displays visual output from the computer, including text, images, and videos, allowing users to interact with the system visually.

Additional Information:

  • Printer is an output device that produces hard copies of documents.
  • Track Ball is an input device used to control the cursor.
  • Scanner is an input device used to convert physical documents into digital images.

question:
Which among the following ports is also known as Line Printer Port?

CGL 2022 Tier II Paper I
option_3: High Definition Media Interface
solution:
• The Parallel port is also known as the Line Printer Port.
  • It was traditionally used to connect printers and other peripheral devices to a computer.
  • Parallel ports transmit multiple bits of data simultaneously, making them suitable for printer connections.

Additional Information:

  • Video Graphic Array (VGA) port is used for video output to monitors.
  • High Definition Multimedia Interface (HDMI) is used for high-definition audio and video signals.
  • Display port is a digital display interface used to connect monitors.

question:
Which among the following statements is incorrect about Central Processing Unit?

CGL 2022 Tier II Paper I
option_1: Control Unit controls the order in which instructions enter and leave the processor and how the instructions are executed.
option_2: Arithmetic Logic Unit is also known as the mathematical brain of a computer.
option_3: Control Unit directs and manages operation sequences.
option_4: Arithmetic Logic Unit is responsible for taking the input, converting it into a signal, and storing it for further processing.
solution:
• Option (d) Arithmetic Logic Unit is responsible for taking the input, converting it into a signal, and storing it for further processing is incorrect about the Central Processing Unit (CPU).
  • The Arithmetic Logic Unit (ALU) is responsible for performing arithmetic and logical operations, not for taking input or storing data.
  • Taking input, converting it into signals, and storing data is typically handled by input devices and memory units, not the ALU.

Additional Information:

  • The Control Unit manages and controls the sequence of operations within the CPU.
  • The ALU is often called the “mathematical brain” because it performs calculations and logical comparisons.
  • Input conversion and data storage are functions of input devices, registers, and memory, separate from the ALU.

question:
_______ is a reading device that reads printed text by scanning it character by character.

CGL 2022 Tier II Paper I
option_2: Magnetic Ink Card Reader (MICR)
solution:
• Optical Character Reader (OCR) is a reading device that scans printed text character by character and converts it into digital data.
  • OCR is widely used to digitize printed documents, making them editable and searchable on computers.

Additional Information:

  • Digitizer converts analog information into digital form, often used for drawings or graphics.
  • Magnetic Ink Character Recognition (MICR) is used mainly in banking to read special ink characters on cheques.
  • Track Ball is an input device used to control the cursor, not for reading printed text.

question:
Which among the following statements is incorrect?

CGL 2022 Tier II Paper I
option_1: Uploading is a procedure for copying data from the device to the webserver.
option_2: Downloading is a procedure of copying files from the webserver to the machine.
option_3: Data travels from user’s device to the web server while uploading.
option_4: Memory is required in the webserver to downloading anything.
solution:
• Option (d) Memory is required in the webserver to downloading anything is incorrect.
  • Downloading involves copying data from the webserver to the user’s device; it primarily requires memory/storage on the user’s device, not on the webserver.
  • The webserver stores the data, but it does not need additional memory specifically for the download process.

Additional Information:

  • Uploading sends data from the user’s device to the webserver.
  • Downloading receives data from the webserver to the user’s device.
  • Both uploading and downloading involve data transfer over the internet but use storage on the respective devices accordingly.

question:
Which among the following keyboard shortcuts open the properties for the selected item on a Windows 10 home screen?

CGL 2022 Tier II Paper I
solution:
• The keyboard shortcut Alt + Enter opens the Properties window for the selected item on a Windows 10 home screen.
  • This shortcut provides detailed information and settings for files, folders, or shortcuts.

Additional Information:

  • Ctrl + Enter does not open properties; it may be used in different contexts like entering a URL in some browsers.
  • Ctrl + Shift + Spacebar and Alt + Shift + Spacebar are not standard shortcuts for opening properties.
  • Using Alt + Enter is a quick way to view or change file and folder attributes.

question:
Which among the following type of computer is also known as notebook?

CGL 2022 Tier II Paper I
solution:
• Laptop Computer is also known as a notebook.
  • It is a portable personal computer designed for mobile use with a built-in screen, keyboard, and battery.
  • Laptops are lightweight and compact, making them convenient for use on the go.

Additional Information:

  • Multi Core refers to processors with multiple cores, not a type of computer.
  • Work Station is a high-performance computer designed for professional use, typically larger and less portable.
  • Micro Computer is a general term for small computers, including desktops and laptops, but "notebook" specifically refers to laptops.

question:
Which among the following statements is incorrect?

CGL 2022 Tier II Paper I
option_1: Magnetic tape drivers are not suitable for storage of data that need to be accessed randomly.
option_2: There is no addressing in the magnetic tapes.
option_3: A magnetic tape consists of vertical columns called frames.
option_4: Magnetic tape consists of horizontal rows called channels or tracks.
solution:
• Option (a) Magnetic tape drivers are not suitable for storage of data that need to be accessed randomly is incorrect as stated in the context of the question, but actually, this statement is correct in general knowledge.
  • Magnetic tapes are sequential access devices, meaning they are not suitable for random access to data. You have to go through data sequentially to reach a specific point, making random access slow and inefficient.
  • So, the incorrect statement among the options is actually (c) A magnetic tape consists of vertical columns called frames, because magnetic tapes have horizontal rows called channels or tracks, not vertical columns.

Additional Information:

  • Magnetic tapes store data sequentially on long strips of plastic tape coated with magnetic material.
  • Channels or tracks run lengthwise (horizontally) along the tape.
  • Frames are not typically used to describe magnetic tape structure in this context.

question:
Which among the following statements is incorrect for input devices?

CGL 2022 Tier II Paper I
option_1: Input devices accepts user data.
option_2: Input devices are also called as peripheral device.
option_3: Optical Mark Reader is an input device.
option_4: Input devices helps computer in receiving data.
solution:
• Option (b) Input devices are also called as peripheral device is incorrect.
  • While input devices are a type of peripheral device, not all peripheral devices are input devices.
  • Peripheral devices include input devices, output devices, and storage devices connected to a computer.
  • Input devices specifically accept user data and send it to the computer for processing.

Additional Information:

  • Examples of input devices include keyboard, mouse, scanner, and Optical Mark Reader (OMR).
  • Peripheral devices broadly refer to any external device connected to the computer.
  • Output devices and storage devices are also peripheral devices but are not input devices.

question:
Which among the following ports is also called as mouse port?

CGL 2022 Tier II Paper I
option_1: High Definition Media Interface
solution:
• The PS/2 port is also called the mouse port.
  • It is a 6-pin mini-DIN connector commonly used to connect a mouse or keyboard to a computer.
  • PS/2 ports were widely used before USB became the standard for peripherals.

Additional Information:

  • High Definition Multimedia Interface (HDMI) is used for audio and video output.
  • FireWire is used for high-speed data transfer, especially with multimedia devices.
  • Video Graphics Array (VGA) is used to connect monitors for video output.

question:
_________, the first ‘made in India’ petascale supercomputer that was deployed at IIT Roorkee in March 2022, has a supercomputing capacity of 1.66 Petaflops.

RRB Group-D 02/09/2022 (Shift-II)
solution:
• The correct answer is (b) PARAM Ganga.
  • PARAM Ganga is the first 'Made in India' petascale supercomputer, deployed at IIT Roorkee in March 2022.
  • It has a supercomputing capacity of 1.66 petaflops, making it capable of performing 1.66 quadrillion floating point operations per second.

Additional Information:

  • PARAM Ganga was developed under the National Supercomputing Mission (NSM) by C-DAC.
  • It supports high-end computation for research and education in science and engineering fields.
  • It is designed with a mix of indigenous hardware and software components, promoting self-reliance in supercomputing.

question:
What is the capacity of the recently commissioned supercomputer Param Pravega under the National Supercomputing Mission?

RRB NTPC Stage-II 14/06/2022 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Param Pravega supercomputer has a total computing capacity of 3 Petaflops.
  • It was commissioned under the National Supercomputing Mission (NSM) and installed at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bengaluru.
  • It is designed to support high-end computational tasks like scientific simulations, climate research, and artificial intelligence.

Additional Information:

  • The system uses a combination of Intel Xeon processors and NVIDIA GPU nodes for powerful hybrid computing performance.
  • Param Pravega enhances India’s supercomputing capabilities and promotes research in critical scientific domains.

question:
PARAM Siddhi refers to:

RRB NTPC Stage-I 24/07/2021 (Shift-I)
option_2: An Artificial Intelligence supercomputer
solution:
• PARAM Siddhi refers to PARAM Siddhi-AI, which is a high-performance computing system developed in India.
  • It is an Artificial Intelligence (AI) supercomputer created by the Centre for Development of Advanced Computing (C-DAC) under the National Supercomputing Mission.
  • PARAM Siddhi achieved a ranking of 63rd in the Top500 list of the world’s most powerful supercomputers (as of November 2020).

Additional Information:

  • PARAM Siddhi has a processing speed of 5.267 petaflops.
  • It is primarily used for applications in AI, machine learning, and deep learning in fields like healthcare, education, and agriculture.
  • This system boosts India’s national capability in AI computing and research.

question:
Mac is a type of personal computer made by:

RRB NTPC Stage-I 21/03/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Mac refers to the Macintosh line of personal computers.
  • It is developed, manufactured, and sold by Apple Inc.
  • The first Macintosh was introduced in 1984 by Apple and is known for its graphical user interface and sleek design.

Additional Information:

  • Popular models include MacBook Air, MacBook Pro, iMac, Mac mini, and Mac Studio.
  • macOS is the operating system that runs on Mac computers.
  • Apple is known for integrating hardware and software for a smooth user experience.
